info.title: IA-Connect Dynamic Code
info.description: IA-Connect is a Robotic Process Automation (RPA) platform which adds RPA functionality from the Cloud to on-premises virtual machines or over Citrix or Microsoft Remote Desktop (RDS) connections. This is the module for developing dynamic code modules.

post.description: Uploads a DotNet assembly from the computer where the IA-Connect Director is running to the IA-Connect Agent where it is loaded into memory and will be used if referenced by dynamic DotNet code.

LocalAssemblyFilePath.title: Local assembly file path
LocalAssemblyFilePath.description: The file path to the local assembly file in the local session (where the IA-Connect Director is running).

AssemblyName.title: Assembly name
AssemblyName.description: The name of the assembly to be imported.

Compress.title: Compress
Compress.description: Should the assembly be compressed before uploading?

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

post.description: Adds a folder path (on the computer where the IA-Connect Agent is running) to the list of folders for the IA-Connect Agent to scan when it tries to load an external reference.

FolderPath.title: Folder path
FolderPath.description: The path to the folder to be added to the list of folders for the IA-Connect Agent to scan when it tries to load an external reference.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

post.description: Reset the additional list of folders for the IA-Connect Agent to scan when it tries to load an external reference.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

post.description: Reports whether PowerShell automation is available on the computer where the IA-Connect Agent is running. If PowerShell automation is not available, PowerShell automation actions will not work.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

PowerShellAutomationIsInstalled.title: Is PowerShell automation installed
PowerShellAutomationIsInstalled.description: Returns true if PowerShell automation is available, or false if not.

post.description: Searches for a specified PowerShell module on the computer where the IA-Connect Agent is running and returns whether it is installed.

PowerShellModuleName.title: PowerShell module
PowerShellModuleName.description: The name of the PowerShell module to search for.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

PowerShellModuleIsInstalled.title: Is PowerShell module installed
PowerShellModuleIsInstalled.description: Returns true if the specified PowerShell module is installed, or false if not.

post.description: Runs a PowerShell script in the session where the IA-Connect Agent is running, where the script contents are passed to the IA-Connect Agent in the 'PowerShell script contents' (PowerShellScriptContents) input. This is the recommended action for running your own custom PowerShell code. This action can also be used to retrieve the results from a previous execution of a PowerShell script, run as an Agent thread. The Agent executes the PowerShell using Microsoft PowerShell v3.x to v5.x (whichever version is installed), not PowerShell core (6.x onwards).

PowerShellScriptContents.title: PowerShell script contents
PowerShellScriptContents.description: The contents of the PowerShell script to execute. IA-Connect will execute this script as-is by passing directly to the PowerShell automation engine. No PowerShell script is actually created on-disk.

ComputerName.title: Computer name
ComputerName.description: The name of the computer to run the PowerShell script on. If left blank, the script will be run on the computer where the IA-Connect Agent is running.

IsNoResultAnError.title: Is no result an error
IsNoResultAnError.description: If no data is returned by the PowerShell command, does this suggest an error?

ReturnComplexTypes.title: Return complex types
ReturnComplexTypes.description: Should properties which have complex types (as opposed to a simple type such as System.String or System.Boolean or System.Date) be returned?

ReturnBooleanAsBoolean.title: Return boolean as boolean
ReturnBooleanAsBoolean.description: Should Boolean properties be returned as a Booleans? If false, these are returned as strings.

ReturnNumericAsDecimal.title: Return numeric as decimal
ReturnNumericAsDecimal.description: Should Numeric properties be returned as a Numerics? If false, these are returned as strings.

ReturnDateAsDate.title: Return date as date
ReturnDateAsDate.description: Should Date properties be returned as a Dates? If false, these are returned as strings.

PropertiesToReturnAsCollectionJSON.title: Properties to return as collection
PropertiesToReturnAsCollectionJSON.description: Some properties (in the PowerShell return results) are collections of values (e.g. an array or table) and by default are not returned in the IA-Connect PowerShell response. This option allows you to specify which properties IA-Connect should attempt to return as a collection and can be entered in JSON or CSV format. For example: To return the EmailAddresses and MemberOf array properties, enter [{"PropertyName": "EmailAddresses"}, {"PropertyName": "MemberOf"}] (JSON format) or EmailAddresses,MemberOf (CSV format).

AuthenticationMechanism.title: Authentication mechanism
AuthenticationMechanism.description: The authentication mechanism to be used if connecting to a remote computer or running the script as an alternative user. Supported values are 'Basic', 'Credssp', 'Default', 'Digest', 'Kerberos' and 'Negotiate'.

ConnectionAttempts.title: Connection attempts
ConnectionAttempts.description: The number of connections to attempt if connecting to a remote computer.

Username.title: Username
Username.description: The username to be used if running the script as an alternative user.

Password.title: Password
Password.description: The password to be used if running the script as an alternative user.

RunScriptAsThread.title: Run script as thread
RunScriptAsThread.description: If set to false (the default), the IA-Connect Agent will run the PowerShell script immediately and return the results to the Director when the script completes. If running a long or complex PowerShell script, this action may time out. If set to true, the IA-Connect Agent will run the PowerShell script as an Agent thread and the IA-Connect Director (or Orchestrator, PowerShell module, Blue Prism) can monitor the status of this Agent thread, waiting for it to complete. This allows long or complex PowerShell scripts to run without timeouts. IA-Connect Agents 9.3 and earlier cannot run PowerShell scripts as an Agent thread.

RetrieveOutputDataFromThreadId.title: Retrieve output data for thread Id
RetrieveOutputDataFromThreadId.description: If you previously ran a PowerShell script as an Agent thread and set 'Seconds to wait for thread' to 0, provide the Agent thread Id to retrieve the results. This Agent thread Id will have been provided by the earlier call to this action. Set to 0 (the default) if you are simply running a PowerShell script (and hence not retrieving the results of a previous PowerShell script run as an Agent thread).

SecondsToWaitForThread.title: Seconds to wait for thread
SecondsToWaitForThread.description: If 'Run script as thread' is set to true, how many seconds to wait for the Agent thread to complete. If the Agent thread running the PowerShell script hasn't completed in this time, an exception will be raised. Set to 0 to bypass the wait: The Agent will continue to run the PowerShell script, but also be available for the next action. You can then retrieve the script results at a later time by using the action 'Wait for Agent thread to complete successfully' to wait for the Agent thread to complete and then re-run this 'Run PowerShell script' action with the input 'Retrieve output data for thread Id' set to the Agent thread Id.

ScriptContainsStoredPassword.title: Script contains stored password
ScriptContainsStoredPassword.description: Set to true if the script contains an IA-Connect stored password identifier, in the format {IAConnectPassword:StoredPasswordIdentifier} or an IA-Connect Orchestrator generic credential, in the format {OrchestratorCredential:FriendlyName}. The { } phrase will be replaced by the specified password, escaped and placed in single quotes (unless it is already in quotes in the script).

LogVerboseOutput.title: Log verbose output
LogVerboseOutput.description: Set to true to log any PowerShell verbose output into the IA-Connect logs. This could be useful for debugging.

ReturnSecureStrings.title: Return secure strings
ReturnSecureStrings.description: Set to true to return any secure string properties in the PowerShell script output. Set to false (the default) to not return any properties that are held as a secure string. Only set to true if you know what you are doing, since this could result in passwords being transmitted (if there are passwords in the PowerShell script output).

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

PowerShellJSONOutput.title: PowerShell output JSON
PowerShellJSONOutput.description: The output of the PowerShell script, formatted as JSON.

ThreadId.title: Thread Id
ThreadId.description: If the PowerShell script is being run as an Agent thread, this output will hold the Agent thread Id which can be used to monitor the PowerShell script execution and retrieve the PowerShell script results when the script has completed.

post.description: Gets the version of PowerShell in the session where the IA-Connect Agent is running. This detects Microsoft PowerShell v3.x to v5.x, not PowerShell core (6.x onwards).

ComputerName.title: Computer name
ComputerName.description: The name of the computer to check the PowerShell version. If left blank, the computer where the IA-Connect Agent is running will be used.

AuthenticationMechanism.title: Authentication mechanism
AuthenticationMechanism.description: The authentication mechanism to be used if connecting to a remote computer or running the script as an alternative user. Supported values are 'Basic', 'Credssp', 'Default', 'Digest', 'Kerberos' and 'Negotiate'.

ConnectionAttempts.title: Connection attempts
ConnectionAttempts.description: The number of connections to attempt if connecting to a remote computer.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

PowerShellMajorVersion.title: PowerShell major version
PowerShellMajorVersion.description: The major (integer) version of PowerShell. For example: PowerShell 5.1 would return 5.

PowerShellMinorVersion.title: PowerShell minor version
PowerShellMinorVersion.description: The minor (after the decimal place) version of PowerShell. For example: PowerShell 5.1 would return 1.

post.description: Performs a regular expression (regex) match on an input string and returns whether the string matched the expression and details of the match.

TextToMatch.title: Input text to match
TextToMatch.description: The input text to match against the regular expression.

Regex.title: Regular expression
Regex.description: The regular expression to match the input text against.

SearchIndex.title: Search index
SearchIndex.description: The index of the match result to retrieve, starting at 1. If you want to match the first result (the default behaviour), enter 1. For example: If an input string is expected to match the regular expression in 5 places and you are interested in the 4th match, enter 4.

CaseSensitive.title: Case sensitive match
CaseSensitive.description: Set to true (the default) for a case-sensitive match (e.g. A is not a) or set to false for a case-insensitive match (e.g. A and a are treated as identical).

RegexTimeoutInSeconds.title: Regex timeout in seconds
RegexTimeoutInSeconds.description: The maximum number of seconds the regular expression can be processed before timing-out. This stops infinite loops caused by certain regular expressions.

SuccessfulMatch.title: Successful match
SuccessfulMatch.description: True if there was a successful match (at the specified search index) or false if there was not.

MatchStringValue.title: Match string value
MatchStringValue.description: If there was a successful match, this string value holds the text from the input text which matched the regular expression.

MatchIndex.title: Match position index
MatchIndex.description: If there was a successful match, this value holds the position within the input text to match where the match is located. This value starts at 0 which represents the very start of the input text string.

MatchStringLength.title: Match string length
MatchStringLength.description: If there was a successful match, this value holds the length of the text from the input text which matched the regular expression (i.e. the length of the output value 'Match string value').

post.description: Performs a regular expression (regex) match on an input string and returns all matches in a string array. The array will be empty if there were no matches.

TextToMatch.title: Input text to match
TextToMatch.description: The input text to match against the regular expression.

Regex.title: Regular expression
Regex.description: The regular expression to match the input text against.

MaximumMatches.title: Maximum matches to perform
MaximumMatches.description: The maximum amount of regular expression matches to perform. For an unlimited number of matches (i.e. keep matching until there are no more matches) enter no value or a value of 0 (the default). This input is designed to avoid infinite regular expression loops by putting a limit on the number of matches.

CaseSensitive.title: Case sensitive match
CaseSensitive.description: Set to true (the default) for a case-sensitive match (e.g. A is not a) or set to false for a case-insensitive match (e.g. A and a are treated as identical).

TrimResults.title: Trim results
TrimResults.description: Set to true (the default) if each individual output array element should be trimmed.

RemoveEmptyResults.title: Remove empty results
RemoveEmptyResults.description: Set to true if empty output array elements should be removed from the output array (i.e. you don't want empty results).

RegexTimeoutInSeconds.title: Regex timeout in seconds
RegexTimeoutInSeconds.description: The maximum number of seconds the regular expression can be processed before timing-out. This stops infinite loops caused by certain regular expressions.

OutputArray.title: Output array
OutputArray.description: The output string array which contains the individual regular expression matches.

NumberOfElementsInOutput.title: Number of elements in output
NumberOfElementsInOutput.description: The number of elements in the output array.

post.summary: Split string using a regular expression
post.description: Splits an input string using a regular expression (regex) match and returns the individual split components of the string as a string array.

TextToSplit.title: Input text to split
TextToSplit.description: The input text to split against the regular expression.

Regex.title: Regular expression
Regex.description: The regular expression to split the input text against.

CaseSensitive.title: Case sensitive split
CaseSensitive.description: Set to true (the default) for a case-sensitive split (e.g. A is not a) or set to false for a case-insensitive split (e.g. A and a are treated as identical).

TrimResults.title: Trim results
TrimResults.description: Set to true (the default) if each individual output array element should be trimmed.

RemoveEmptyResults.title: Remove empty results
RemoveEmptyResults.description: Set to true if empty output array elements should be removed from the output array (i.e. you don't want empty results).

RegexTimeoutInSeconds.title: Regex timeout in seconds
RegexTimeoutInSeconds.description: The maximum number of seconds the regular expression can be processed before timing-out. This stops infinite loops caused by certain regular expressions.

OutputArray.title: Output array
OutputArray.description: The output string array which contains the individual components of the string, split using the regular expression.

NumberOfElementsInOutput.title: Number of elements in output
NumberOfElementsInOutput.description: The number of elements in the output array.

post.description: Performs a regular expression (regex) match on an input string and returns a list of matched group names and values.

TextToMatch.title: Input text to match
TextToMatch.description: The input text to match against the regular expression.

Regex.title: Regular expression
Regex.description: The regular expression to match the input text against.

GroupsToRetrieve.title: Groups to retrieve
GroupsToRetrieve.description: A string array containing the names of the regular expression groups to retrieve. If a blank array is provided, all groups are retrieved. For example: If a regular expression contains (?<NeedsUpdating>(Yes|No)) and you specify that the 'NeedsUpdating' group should be retrieved, then the matched value of that named group will be returned.

SearchIndex.title: Search index
SearchIndex.description: The index of the match result to retrieve, starting at 1. If you want to match the first result (the default behaviour), enter 1. For example: If an input string is expected to match the regular expression in 5 places and you are interested in the 4th match, enter 4.

CaseSensitive.title: Case sensitive match
CaseSensitive.description: Set to true (the default) for a case-sensitive match (e.g. A is not a) or set to false for a case-insensitive match (e.g. A and a are treated as identical).

RegexTimeoutInSeconds.title: Regex timeout in seconds
RegexTimeoutInSeconds.description: The maximum number of seconds the regular expression can be processed before timing-out. This stops infinite loops caused by certain regular expressions.

RegexGroups.title: Regular expression groups
RegexGroups.description: An array containing the names and values of the regular expression groups matched against the input string.

NumberOfRegexGroups.title: Number of groups
NumberOfRegexGroups.description: The number of regular expression groups.

post.description: Takes an array of input variables and returns in JSON format and optionally as a JSON table.

InputVariables.title: Input variables
InputVariables.description: An input array of variable names, their data type and their values.

ReturnAsJSONTable.title: Return as JSON table
ReturnAsJSONTable.description: If set to true, the JSON will be returned in a table / datatable format (i.e. in the format [{}]). If set to false, the JSON will be returned as a single entity (i.e. in the format {}). Which format to use depends on what you are doing with the JSON. Most IA-Connect actions expect datatable format.

OutputJSON.title: Output JSON
OutputJSON.description: The variables and their values encoded in JSON format.

post.summary: Get JSON table from string array
post.description: Takes an input array of string items and returns as a JSON table.

ColumnName.title: Column name
ColumnName.description: The name to use for the table column.

DropEmptyItems.title: Drop empty items
DropEmptyItems.description: Set to true to ignore (drop) empty items in the array. Set to false to include all items.

OutputJSONTable.title: Output JSON table
OutputJSONTable.description: The output table in JSON format.

NumberOfRows.title: Number of rows
NumberOfRows.description: The number of rows in the output table.

NumberOfColumns.title: Number of columns
NumberOfColumns.description: The number of columns in the output table (should always be 1).

post.description: Takes an input JSON table, filters the table (using .NET DataView rowfilter syntax) and returns a new JSON table. If you want to filter an actual table (i.e. not in JSON format), use the action 'Filter table'. If you want to filter a string array, use the action 'Filter string array'.

JSONTable.title: Input JSON table
JSONTable.description: The input table in JSON format.

Filter.title: Filter
Filter.description: The filter in .NET DataView rowfilter syntax. For example: [Name] like '*Element'.

SortColumnName.title: Sort column name
SortColumnName.description: An optional column name to sort by, after applying the filter. If you wish to sort by multiple columns then list the columns comma separated.

Ascending.title: Sort ascending
Ascending.description: Set to true to sort in an ascending order. Set to false to sort in a descending order.

SortColumnName2.title: Sort column name 2
SortColumnName2.description: An optional second column name to sort by (after sorting by the first column).

Ascending2.title: Sort ascending 2
Ascending2.description: Set to true to sort the second column name in an ascending order. Set to false to sort in a descending order.

SortColumnName3.title: Sort column name 3
SortColumnName3.description: An optional third column name to sort by (after sorting by the first and second columns).

Ascending3.title: Sort ascending 3
Ascending3.description: Set to true to sort the third column name in an ascending order. Set to false to sort in a descending order.

OutputJSONTable.title: Output JSON table
OutputJSONTable.description: The output table in JSON format.

NumberOfRows.title: Number of rows
NumberOfRows.description: The number of rows in the output table.

NumberOfColumns.title: Number of columns
NumberOfColumns.description: The number of columns in the output table.

post.description: Takes an input table, filters the table (using .NET DataView rowfilter syntax) and returns a new table. If you want to filter a table in JSON format, use the action 'Filter JSON table'. If you want to filter a string array, use the action 'Filter string array'.

Filter.title: Filter
Filter.description: The filter in .NET DataView rowfilter syntax. For example: [Name] like '*Element'.

SortColumnName.title: Sort column name
SortColumnName.description: An optional column name to sort by, after applying the filter. If you wish to sort by multiple columns then list the columns comma separated.

Ascending.title: Sort ascending
Ascending.description: Set to true to sort in an ascending order. Set to false to sort in a descending order.

SortColumnName2.title: Sort column name 2
SortColumnName2.description: An optional second column name to sort by (after sorting by the first column).

Ascending2.title: Sort ascending 2
Ascending2.description: Set to true to sort the second column name in an ascending order. Set to false to sort in a descending order.

SortColumnName3.title: Sort column name 3
SortColumnName3.description: An optional third column name to sort by (after sorting by the first and second columns).

Ascending3.title: Sort ascending 3
Ascending3.description: Set to true to sort the third column name in an ascending order. Set to false to sort in a descending order.

NumberOfRows.title: Number of rows
NumberOfRows.description: The number of rows in the output table.

NumberOfColumns.title: Number of columns
NumberOfColumns.description: The number of columns in the output table.

post.description: Takes an input table, sorts one or more rows and returns a new table. If you want to sort a table in JSON format, use the action 'Sort JSON table'. If you want to sort a string array, use the action 'Sort string array'.

SortColumnName.title: Sort column name
SortColumnName.description: The column name to sort by. If you wish to sort by multiple columns then list the columns comma separated.

Ascending.title: Sort ascending
Ascending.description: Set to true to sort in an ascending order. Set to false to sort in a descending order.

SortColumnName2.title: Sort column name 2
SortColumnName2.description: An optional second column name to sort by (after sorting by the first column).

Ascending2.title: Sort ascending 2
Ascending2.description: Set to true to sort the second column name in an ascending order. Set to false to sort in a descending order.

SortColumnName3.title: Sort column name 3
SortColumnName3.description: An optional third column name to sort by (after sorting by the first and second columns).

Ascending3.title: Sort ascending 3
Ascending3.description: Set to true to sort the third column name in an ascending order. Set to false to sort in a descending order.

NumberOfRows.title: Number of rows
NumberOfRows.description: The number of rows in the output table.

NumberOfColumns.title: Number of columns
NumberOfColumns.description: The number of columns in the output table.

post.description: Takes an input JSON table, sorts the table and returns a new JSON table. If you want to sort an actual table (i.e. not in JSON format), use the action 'Sort table'. If you want to sort a string array, use the action 'Sort string array'.

JSONTable.title: Input JSON table
JSONTable.description: The input table in JSON format.

SortColumnName.title: Sort column name
SortColumnName.description: The column name to sort by.

Ascending.title: Sort ascending
Ascending.description: Set to true to sort in an ascending order. Set to false to sort in a descending order.

SortColumnName2.title: Sort column name 2
SortColumnName2.description: An optional second column name to sort by (after sorting by the first column).

Ascending2.title: Sort ascending 2
Ascending2.description: Set to true to sort the second column name in an ascending order. Set to false to sort in a descending order.

SortColumnName3.title: Sort column name 3
SortColumnName3.description: An optional third column name to sort by (after sorting by the first and second columns).

Ascending3.title: Sort ascending 3
Ascending3.description: Set to true to sort the third column name in an ascending order. Set to false to sort in a descending order.

OutputJSONTable.title: Output JSON table
OutputJSONTable.description: The output table in JSON format.

NumberOfRows.title: Number of rows
NumberOfRows.description: The number of rows in the output table.

NumberOfColumns.title: Number of columns
NumberOfColumns.description: The number of columns in the output table.

post.description: Takes an input array of string items and returns as a table.

ColumnName.title: Column name
ColumnName.description: The name to use for the table column.

DropEmptyItems.title: Drop empty items
DropEmptyItems.description: Set to true to ignore (drop) empty items in the array. Set to false to include all items.

NumberOfRows.title: Number of rows
NumberOfRows.description: The number of rows in the output table.

NumberOfColumns.title: Number of columns
NumberOfColumns.description: The number of columns in the output table (should always be 1).

post.description: Takes an input table in JSON format and returns as a table. This is known as deserialization.

JSONTable.title: Input JSON table
JSONTable.description: The input table in JSON format.

StartRowIndex.title: Start row index
StartRowIndex.description: The index of the first row to retrieve. Use 1 to start at the first row, N to start at the Nth row.

NumberOfRowsToRetrieve.title: Number of rows to retrieve
NumberOfRowsToRetrieve.description: The number of rows to retrieve. Use 0 (or leave blank) to retrieve all rows.

StartColumnIndex.title: Start column index
StartColumnIndex.description: The index of the first column to retrieve. Use 1 to start at the first column, N to start at the Nth column. If you wish to specify the first column to retrieve by name, leave this input blank and use the input 'Start column name' instead.

StartColumnName.title: Start column name
StartColumnName.description: The optional name of the first column to retrieve. If you wish to retrieve columns by index, leave this input blank and use the input 'Start column index' instead.

NumberOfColumnsToRetrieve.title: Number of columns to retrieve
NumberOfColumnsToRetrieve.description: The number of columns to retrieve. Use 0 (or leave blank) to retrieve all columns.

NumberOfRows.title: Number of rows
NumberOfRows.description: The number of rows in the output table.

NumberOfColumns.title: Number of columns
NumberOfColumns.description: The number of columns in the output table (should always be 1).

post.description: Takes an input array of string items, sorts the array and returns a new array. If you want to sort a table, use the action 'Sort table'. If you want to sort a table in JSON format, use the action 'Sort JSON table'.

Ascending.title: Sort ascending
Ascending.description: Set to true to sort in an ascending order. Set to false to sort in a descending order.

CaseSensitive.title: Case sensitive
CaseSensitive.description: Set to true for a case sensitive sort (i.e. upper and lower case sorted separately). Set to false for a case insensitive sort.

OutputArray.title: Sorted output array
OutputArray.description: The sorted output array of strings.

NumberOfItems.title: Number of items
NumberOfItems.description: The number of items in the output array.

post.description: Takes an input array of string items, filters the array (using .NET DataView rowfilter syntax) and returns a new array. If you want to filter a table, use the action 'Filter table'. If you want to filter a table in JSON format, use the action 'Filter JSON table'.

ColumnName.title: Column name
ColumnName.description: The name to use for the table column holding the array during the filter operation. This name can then be used as the column name in the .NET DataView rowfilter syntax. For example MyColumn which can then be referred to as [MyColumn].

Filter.title: Filter
Filter.description: The filter in .NET DataView rowfilter syntax. For example: [Name] like '*Element'.

OutputArray.title: Filtered output array
OutputArray.description: The filtered output array of strings.

NumberOfItems.title: Number of items
NumberOfItems.description: The number of items in the output array.

post.summary: Insert a row into a string array
post.description: Takes an input array of string items, inserts a row at a specified position and returns a new array. If you want to insert a row into a table, use the action 'Insert a row into a table'. If you want to insert a row into a table in JSON format, use the action 'Insert a row into a JSON table'.

RowIndex.title: Row index
RowIndex.description: The index of the row to insert at. Use 0 to insert at the start of the array, 1 to insert after row 1, N to insert after row N. -1 or any number equal to or higher than the number of items in the array to insert at the end of the array (useful if you don't know how long the array is).

ValueToInsert.title: Value to insert
ValueToInsert.description: The string value to insert in the new row. Leave blank if you want to insert an empty row.

NumberOfItems.title: Number of items
NumberOfItems.description: The number of items in the output array.

post.summary: Insert a row into a table
post.description: Takes an input table, inserts a row at a specified position and returns a new table. If you want to insert a string into a string array, use the action 'Insert a row into a string array'. If you want to insert a row into a table in JSON format, use the action 'Insert a row into a JSON table'.

RowIndex.title: Row index
RowIndex.description: The index of the row to insert at. Use 0 to insert at the start of the table, 1 to insert after row 1, N to insert after row N. -1 or any number equal to or higher than the number of items in the table to insert at the end of the table (useful if you don't know how long the table is).

RowToInsertJSON.title: JSON row to insert
RowToInsertJSON.description: The contents of the row to insert in JSON format. Leave blank if you want to insert an empty row. For example: To insert 'Simon' into the column 'Name' use {"Name":"Simon"} and to additionally insert 'England' into the column 'Country' use {"Name":"Simon","Country":"England"}.

NumberOfRows.title: Number of rows
NumberOfRows.description: The number of rows in the output table.

NumberOfColumns.title: Number of columns
NumberOfColumns.description: The number of columns in the output table.

post.summary: Insert a row into a JSON table
post.description: Takes an input table in JSON format, inserts a row at a specified position and returns a new table in JSON format. If you want to insert a row into an actual table (i.e. not in JSON format), use the action 'Insert a row into a table'. If you want to insert a string into a string array, use the action 'Insert a row into a string array'.

JSONTable.title: Input JSON table
JSONTable.description: The input table in JSON format.

RowIndex.title: Row index
RowIndex.description: The index of the row to insert at. Use 0 to insert at the start of the table, 1 to insert after row 1, N to insert after row N. -1 or any number equal to or higher than the number of items in the table to insert at the end of the table (useful if you don't know how long the table is).

RowToInsertJSON.title: JSON row to insert
RowToInsertJSON.description: The contents of the row to insert in JSON format. Leave blank if you want to insert an empty row. For example: To insert 'Simon' into the column 'Name' use {"Name":"Simon"} and to additionally insert 'England' into the column 'Country' use {"Name":"Simon","Country":"England"}.

OutputJSONTable.title: Output JSON table
OutputJSONTable.description: The output table in JSON format.

NumberOfRows.title: Number of rows
NumberOfRows.description: The number of rows in the output table.

NumberOfColumns.title: Number of columns
NumberOfColumns.description: The number of columns in the output table.

post.summary: Insert a row of input variables into a JSON table
post.description: Takes an input table in JSON format, inserts a row created from input variables at a specified position and returns a new table in JSON format. The input row schema should match that of the input table (i.e. Use the same property names and data types). If you want to insert a row into an actual table (i.e. not in JSON format), use the action 'Insert a row into a table'. If you want to insert a string into a string array, use the action 'Insert a row into a string array'.

JSONTable.title: Input JSON table
JSONTable.description: The input table in JSON format.

RowIndex.title: Row index
RowIndex.description: The index of the row to insert at. Use 0 to insert at the start of the table, 1 to insert after row 1, N to insert after row N. -1 or any number equal to or higher than the number of items in the table to insert at the end of the table (useful if you don't know how long the table is).

RowToInsertInputVariables.title: Input variables
RowToInsertInputVariables.description: An input array of variable names, their data type and their values to be added as an additional row to the input table. The schema should match that of the input table (i.e. Use the same property names and data types).

OutputJSONTable.title: Output JSON table
OutputJSONTable.description: The output table in JSON format.

NumberOfRows.title: Number of rows
NumberOfRows.description: The number of rows in the output table.

NumberOfColumns.title: Number of columns
NumberOfColumns.description: The number of columns in the output table.

post.summary: Delete items from a string array
post.description: Takes an input array of string items, deletes an item or items at a specified position and returns a new array. If you want to delete a row or rows from a table, use the action 'Delete a row from a table'. If you want to delete a row or rows from a table in JSON format, use the action 'Delete a row from a JSON table'.

StartItemIndex.title: Start item index
StartItemIndex.description: The index of the item to start deleting at. Use 1 to delete the first item, N to delete the Nth item.

NumberOfItemsToDelete.title: Number of items to delete
NumberOfItemsToDelete.description: The number of items to delete.

NumberOfItems.title: Number of items
NumberOfItems.description: The number of items in the output array.

post.description: Takes an input table, deletes a row or rows at a specified position and returns a new table. If you want to delete a row or rows from a string array, use the action 'Delete a row from a string array'. If you want to delete a row or rows from a table in JSON format, use the action 'Delete a row from a JSON table'.

StartRowIndex.title: Start row index
StartRowIndex.description: The index of the row to start deleting at. Use 1 to delete the first row, N to delete the Nth row.

NumberOfRowsToDelete.title: Number of rows to delete
NumberOfRowsToDelete.description: The number of rows to delete.

NumberOfRows.title: Number of rows
NumberOfRows.description: The number of rows in the output table.

NumberOfColumns.title: Number of columns
NumberOfColumns.description: The number of columns in the output table.

post.summary: Delete rows from a JSON table
post.description: Takes an input table in JSON format, deletes a row or rows at a specified position and returns a new table in JSON format. If you want to delete a row or rows from an actual table (i.e. not in JSON format), use the action 'Delete a row from a table'. If you want to delete a row or rows from a string array, use the action 'Delete a row from a string array'.

JSONTable.title: Input JSON table
JSONTable.description: The input table in JSON format.

StartRowIndex.title: Start row index
StartRowIndex.description: The index of the row to start deleting at. Use 1 to delete the first row, N to delete the Nth row.

NumberOfRowsToDelete.title: Number of rows to delete
NumberOfRowsToDelete.description: The number of rows to delete.

OutputJSONTable.title: Output JSON table
OutputJSONTable.description: The output table in JSON format.

NumberOfRows.title: Number of rows
NumberOfRows.description: The number of rows in the output table.

NumberOfColumns.title: Number of columns
NumberOfColumns.description: The number of columns in the output table.

post.summary: Rename a column in a table
post.description: Takes an input table, renames a specified column and returns a new table. If you want to rename a column from a table in JSON format, use the action 'Rename a column in a JSON table'.

SourceColumnName.title: Source column name
SourceColumnName.description: The name of the column to rename.

NewColumnName.title: New column name
NewColumnName.description: The new name for the column.

NumberOfRows.title: Number of rows
NumberOfRows.description: The number of rows in the output table.

NumberOfColumns.title: Number of columns
NumberOfColumns.description: The number of columns in the output table.

post.summary: Rename a column in a JSON table
post.description: Takes an input table in JSON format, renames a specified column and returns a new table in JSON format. If you want to rename a column from an actual table (i.e. not in JSON format), use the action 'Rename a column in a table'.

JSONTable.title: Input JSON table
JSONTable.description: The input table in JSON format.

SourceColumnName.title: Source column name
SourceColumnName.description: The name of the column to rename.

NewColumnName.title: New column name
NewColumnName.description: The new name for the column.

OutputJSONTable.title: Output JSON table
OutputJSONTable.description: The output table in JSON format.

NumberOfRows.title: Number of rows
NumberOfRows.description: The number of rows in the output table.

NumberOfColumns.title: Number of columns
NumberOfColumns.description: The number of columns in the output table.

post.description: Takes an input table, deletes a column or columns and returns a new table. If you want to delete columns from a table in JSON format, use the action 'Delete columns from a JSON table'.

StartColumnIndex.title: Start column index
StartColumnIndex.description: The index of the column to start deleting at. Use 1 to delete the first column, N to delete the Nth column. If you wish to delete a column by name, leave this input blank and use the input 'Column name to delete' instead.

ColumnNameToDelete.title: Column name to delete
ColumnNameToDelete.description: The optional name of the column to delete. If you wish to delete a column by index, leave this input blank and use the input 'Start column index' instead.

NumberOfColumnsToDelete.title: Number of columns to delete
NumberOfColumnsToDelete.description: The number of columns to delete, starting at the specified index or name.

NumberOfRows.title: Number of rows
NumberOfRows.description: The number of rows in the output table.

NumberOfColumns.title: Number of columns
NumberOfColumns.description: The number of columns in the output table.

post.summary: Delete columns from a JSON table
post.description: Takes an input table in JSON format, deletes a column or columns and returns a new table in JSON format. If you want to delete columns from a actual table (i.e. not in JSON format), use the action 'Delete columns from a table'.

JSONTable.title: Input JSON table
JSONTable.description: The input table in JSON format.

StartColumnIndex.title: Start column index
StartColumnIndex.description: The index of the column to start deleting at. Use 1 to delete the first column, N to delete the Nth column. If you wish to delete a column by name, leave this input blank and use the input 'Column name to delete' instead.

ColumnNameToDelete.title: Column name to delete
ColumnNameToDelete.description: The optional name of the column to delete. If you wish to delete a column by index, leave this input blank and use the input 'Start column index' instead.

NumberOfColumnsToDelete.title: Number of columns to delete
NumberOfColumnsToDelete.description: The number of columns to delete, starting at the specified index or name.

OutputJSONTable.title: Output JSON table
OutputJSONTable.description: The output table in JSON format.

NumberOfRows.title: Number of rows
NumberOfRows.description: The number of rows in the output table.

NumberOfColumns.title: Number of columns
NumberOfColumns.description: The number of columns in the output table.

post.summary: Get string array from table column
post.description: Takes an input table and returns a specified column as a string array. If you want to get a string array from a table in JSON format, use the action 'Get array from JSON table'.

ColumnIndex.title: Column index
ColumnIndex.description: The index of the column to return as an array. Use 1 for the first column, N for the Nth column. If you wish to retrieve a column by name, leave this input blank and use the input 'Column name' instead.

ColumnName.title: Column name
ColumnName.description: The optional name of the column to return as an array. If you wish to retrieve a column by index, leave this input blank and use the input 'Column index' instead.

NumberOfItems.title: Number of items
NumberOfItems.description: The number of items in the output array.

post.summary: Get string array from JSON table column
post.description: Takes an input table in JSON format and returns a specified column as a string array. If you want to get a string array from an actual table (i.e. not in JSON format), use the action 'Get array from table'.

JSONTable.title: Input JSON table
JSONTable.description: The input table in JSON format.

ColumnIndex.title: Column index
ColumnIndex.description: The index of the column to return as an array. Use 1 for the first column, N for the Nth column. If you wish to retrieve a column by name, leave this input blank and use the input 'Column name' instead.

ColumnName.title: Column name
ColumnName.description: The optional name of the column to return as an array. If you wish to retrieve a column by index, leave this input blank and use the input 'Column index' instead.

NumberOfItems.title: Number of items
NumberOfItems.description: The number of items in the output array.

post.summary: Get string from JSON table cell
post.description: Takes an input table in JSON format and returns a specified cell as a string.

JSONTable.title: Input JSON table
JSONTable.description: The input table in JSON format.

RowIndex.title: Row index
RowIndex.description: The index of the row containing the cell to retrieve. Use 1 for the first row, N for the Nth row.

ColumnIndex.title: Column index
ColumnIndex.description: The index of the column containing the cell to retrieve. Use 1 for the first column, N for the Nth column. If you wish to retrieve a column by name, leave this input blank and use the input 'Column name' instead.

ColumnName.title: Column name
ColumnName.description: The optional name of the column containing the cell to retrieve. If you wish to retrieve a column by index, leave this input blank and use the input 'Column index' instead.

OutputString.title: Output string
OutputString.description: The output cell contents as a string.

post.description: Takes an input string and returns the first instance of a string that is located between two specified strings or between a string and the end of the line.

InputString.title: Input string
InputString.description: The input string upon which the search is performed.

EndSearchString.title: End search string
EndSearchString.description: The end search string or leave blank if searching to the end of the line.

SearchLineByLine.title: Search line by line
SearchLineByLine.description: Set to true if you want to search the input string line by line and for the result to only contain the matching string in the current line. Set to false to treat the input string as a single item.

ThrowExceptionIfNotFound.title: Throw exception if not found
ThrowExceptionIfNotFound.description: Set to true if you want an exception raised if the search string was not found, or set to false if the action should return 'String between found'=false when the search string was not found.

TrimResult.title: Trim result
TrimResult.description: Set to true if you want spaces or tabs before or after the result to be trimmed.

SearchIsRegularExpression.title: Search is regular expression
SearchIsRegularExpression.description: Set to true if the search strings are regular expressions. Set to false if the search strings are normal text.

CaseSensitiveSearch.title: Case sensitive search
CaseSensitiveSearch.description: Set to true if the search should be case sensitive. Set to false for case insensitive searches.

SearchStringFound.title: Search string found
SearchStringFound.description: If 'Throw exception if not found' is set to false then this output is set to true if the search string was found, false if not.

StringBetween.title: String between
StringBetween.description: The string found between the specified strings.

post.description: Loads an IA-Connect lookup table from the computer where the IA-Connect Agent is running. These lookup tables can be used by further IA-Connect actions to perform data lookups.

Path.title: Lookup table path
Path.description: The full path to the lookup table. This must be accessible from the session where the IA-Connect Agent is running. If a folder is specified then all files beneath that folder are processed.

RaiseExceptionIfAnyTableFailsToLoad.title: Raise exception if any table fails to load
RaiseExceptionIfAnyTableFailsToLoad.description: If set to true and any IA-Connect lookup table fails to load (for example if there is a problem in the table) then an exception will be raised. This is the default because if any table fails to load, this will usually result in an exception later in the process. If set to false then problem lookup tables will be ignored and only usable lookup tables will be loade3d.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

NumberOfLookupTablesLoaded.title: Number of lookup tables loaded
NumberOfLookupTablesLoaded.description: The number of lookup tables which were successfully loaded.

NumberOfLookupTablesFailedToLoad.title: Number of lookup tables failed to load
NumberOfLookupTablesFailedToLoad.description: The number of lookup tables which failed to load. This will only be set if 'Raise exception if any table fails to load' is set to false, since otherwise there will be an exception.

post.description: Retrieves a summary of the lookup tables currently loaded into the IA-Connect Agent.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

LookupTablesJSON.title: Lookup tables JSON
LookupTablesJSON.description: The lookup tables loaded into the IA-Connect Agent.

NumberOfLookupTables.title: Number of lookup tables
NumberOfLookupTables.description: The number of lookup tables currently loaded into the IA-Connect Agent.

post.description: Removes a lookup table currently loaded into the IA-Connect Agent.

LookupTableName.title: Lookup table name
LookupTableName.description: The name of the lookup table loaded into the IA-Connect Agent.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

RemoveIAConnectLookupTableResult.title: Command result
RemoveIAConnectLookupTableResult.description: The result of the command (success or failure).

ErrorMessage.title: Error message
ErrorMessage.description: If the command was not successful, this will contain the error message that was returned.

post.description: Removes all lookup tables currently loaded into the IA-Connect Agent.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

RemoveAllIAConnectLookupTablesResult.title: Command result
RemoveAllIAConnectLookupTablesResult.description: The result of the command (success or failure).

ErrorMessage.title: Error message
ErrorMessage.description: If the command was not successful, this will contain the error message that was returned.

post.summary: Lookup value from IA-Connect lookup table
post.description: Retrieves a value from a lookup table currently loaded into the IA-Connect Agent.

LookupTableName.title: Lookup table name
LookupTableName.description: The name of the lookup table loaded into the IA-Connect Agent.

InputDataJSON.title: Input data JSON
InputDataJSON.description: Input data to use for the lookup, in JSON format.

SearchResultValueColumnName.title: Search result value column name
SearchResultValueColumnName.description: The column in the lookup table which holds the return value to read.

SearchResultValueColumnIndex.title: Search result value column index
SearchResultValueColumnIndex.description: If set to 1 (the default), the value from the first result column matching the requested name will be returned. Set to a higher value (N) to return the Nth matching column.

RaiseExceptionIfNoMatch.title: Raise exception if no match
RaiseExceptionIfNoMatch.description: Set to true (the default) to raise an exception if the lookup matches no data. Set to false to return a blank string if the lookup matches no data.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

OutputLookupValue.title: Output lookup value
OutputLookupValue.description: The output value from the specified lookup table column, obtained by looking up the input data against the IA-Connect lookup table.

post.summary: Lookup columns from IA-Connect lookup table
post.description: Retrieves one or more columns with a common name from a lookup table currently loaded into the IA-Connect Agent and returns as a table. For example, the lookup table could contain multiple output columns named 'AD group' to represent multiple AD groups and they will be returned as separate rows in the output table.

LookupTableName.title: Lookup table name
LookupTableName.description: The name of the lookup table loaded into the IA-Connect Agent.

InputDataJSON.title: Input data JSON
InputDataJSON.description: Input data to use for the lookup, in JSON format.

SearchResultTableColumnName.title: Search result table column name
SearchResultTableColumnName.description: The name of one or more columns in the lookup table which hold the values to return in the output table.

RaiseExceptionIfNoMatch.title: Raise exception if no match
RaiseExceptionIfNoMatch.description: Set to true (the default) to raise an exception if the lookup matches no data. Set to false to return a blank string if the lookup matches no data.

ReturnBlankCells.title: Return blank cells
ReturnBlankCells.description: Set to true if you want to include blank cells in the return table. Set to false (the default) to only include cells with values.

ReturnFormat.title: Return format
ReturnFormat.description: The format to use when returning the results.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

OutputLookupTableJSON.title: Output lookup table JSON
OutputLookupTableJSON.description: The output table read from the one or more lookup table columns with the specified name, obtained by looking up the input data against the IA-Connect lookup table. The output table will have one column (matching the requested result table column name) and one or more rows, in JSON format.

OutputLookupTable.title: Output lookup table
OutputLookupTable.description: The output table read from the one or more lookup table columns with the specified name, obtained by looking up the input data against the IA-Connect lookup table. The output table will have one column (matching the requested result table column name) and one or more rows.

OutputLookupArray.title: Output lookup array
OutputLookupArray.description: The output array read from the one or more lookup table columns with the specified name, obtained by looking up the input data against the IA-Connect lookup table. The output array is a single column with one or more rows.

NumberOfRowsInOutput.title: Number of rows in output
NumberOfRowsInOutput.description: The number of rows in the output.

post.description: Takes an input string and returns it with specified characters removed. If the specified characters are not located, the original string will be returned.

InputString.title: Input string
InputString.description: The input string upon which the character removal is performed.

CharactersToRemoveFromInputString.title: Characters to remove from input string
CharactersToRemoveFromInputString.description: A string containing all of the characters you wish to remove from the inputs. For example: !@&?^*.

RemoveDiacriticsFromInputString.title: Remove diacritics from input string
RemoveDiacriticsFromInputString.description: If set to true, IA-Connect will attempt to remove all diacritics from the input string, replacing characters with a diacritic with the same character minus the diacritic. For example: replacing 'acute accented a' with 'a'. In scenarios where there is no direct mapping to a simple character, the character is removed. For example: The German sharp S is removed.

RemoveNonAlphaNumericFromInputString.title: Remove non alphanumeric from input string
RemoveNonAlphaNumericFromInputString.description: If set to true, IA-Connect will remove all non-alphanumeric characters from the input string.

RemoveNumericFromInputString.title: Remove numeric characters from input string
RemoveNumericFromInputString.description: If set to true, IA-Connect will remove all numeric characters from the input string.

RemoveLowercaseCharactersFromInputString.title: Remove lowercase characters from input string
RemoveLowercaseCharactersFromInputString.description: If set to true, IA-Connect will remove all lowercase alphabetical characters from the input string.

RemoveUppercaseCharactersFromInputString.title: Remove uppercase characters from input string
RemoveUppercaseCharactersFromInputString.description: If set to true, IA-Connect will remove all uppercase alphabetical characters from the input string.

OutputString.title: Output string
OutputString.description: The string with the removed characters. This will be the original string if no specified characters were found.
